bibl.title: Leonard Martin v. Washington Territory. Commitment
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Unied States Commisison Court Before James G Swan Commision
IUnited States of America territory of Wahington of Judical District} Commisioned
The President of the Untied States of America to the Marshall of the United States in and forsaid Territory. Greeting.

Whereas, complaint has been made before James G Swan, a commision of the US District Court of the 3rd Judicial District W.T. upon the oath of JGClinger that leonet Martin late of said district did on tho might of the 30th of April AD 1885 commit this of lease of selling or disposing of whiskey to Indiands to the form of the states in such case made and provided and against the pace and dignity of the United States and the said Leonat in such case made and provided, and against the peace and dignity of the United States and the said Leonat Martin having been brought before said commisioner in persuance of a warrant of arrest issued upon said complaint and being examined concerning the charge alleged against him regand to give bail in the sum of one hundred dollars for his appearance before the USDistrict Court the Judicial District of Washington Territory holding herms at Prt Townsend on the forth Monday of Agust AD 1885 being the 24th day of said month on the forth day of th next term there of with whith he has jailed to comply.
These are therof to command you to receice the said Leonard Martin into your custody there to remain until discharged a armed by deal comes of law
Territory of Washington County of King } ss

John H.Mc Graw, and Jesse E. George being each first duly sworn, on oath sys: That he is the one of the Respondendts named in the above entitled actioin; that he has heard the foregoing Retun and answer read, knows the contents thereof, and believes the same to be true; that he makes this affidavit because
John H. Mc Graw JWGeorge Subscribed and sworn to before me this 22nd day of May 1885 C.H. Hanford Notary Public in and for King County. Washington Territory.

I, JAMES SEAVEY, Clerk of the District COurt, holding terms at Seattle, in King County, Washington Territory, hereby certify that the foregoing is true copy of the in the foregoing entited cause now on file in my office
... Clerk By Deputy. Received at Seattle, in King County, Washington Territory, this day of 188 ,a true copy of the foregoing.
In the District Court, Third Judicial District holding terms at Seattle

In the Matter if the Application of Leonard Martin Plaintiff vs
for a Writ of Habeas Corpus defendant
Filed this 23rd day of May A.D. 1885 JAMES SEAVEY, Clerk. By James P Ludlow Deputy Clerk.
